Drive through Sligo on the dual carriageway. Pick up the signs for Rosses Point and follow them. After about 5 miles (8km) you get to Rosses Point village.
The bus for Rosses Point leaves the Sligo bus and train station. You can also get on across the road from the Ulster Bank in Sligo town. There are regular buses from Sligo. See Bus Eireann

This is an unusual way to get to Rosses Point. You can contact the MV Spirit, a charter boat that is based in Sligo. They will bring you on the short trip from Sligo harbour out to Rosses Point Pier. You can even take in a bit of fishing or sight seeing on the way. If your lucky on the fishing trip, the Chef's in Austies can cook up your catch for your dinner that night! The return trip can be done on the Sea Star with Daryl from Sligo Boat Charters.
Rosses Point is a small village and is easy to get around on foot or by bike.

value: content=An olde world bar with a great atmosphere and food and drink to match
directions=Across the road from Austies Bar

content=The Rosses Point Guesthouse is a newly opened accommodation option in the seaside town of Rosses Point, just 5 miles from Sligo town. We provide a good value, fun alternative to the existing hotels and B&B's in the area. We have a selection of different bed options, from a hostel style bunk bed in a dorm to a family room or private double rooms for a romantic get-away. The kitchen and common areas of the guesthouse are our greatest asset - with plenty of space for groups to cook, eat, chat and play music.
